name: Goitia Deitz 'Helicopter/Forever'
description: FORMAT 7" Vinyl + Digital Download RELEASED August 6th 2012 CATALOGUE DER010 DETAILS The second release from Goitia Deitz is 'Helicopter/Forever', a double A-side vinyl and three track digital offering that follows on from their debut DiscError release 'Romance/Coma'. 'Helicopter' starts in the heart, beating, pulsing synths that are pumped directly to your feet. Driving dancefloor repetition that takes off into climactic peaks and elated highs. 'Forever' soothes the head, dreamy electronic experiments from a hopefull phuture. Pneumatic beats build, their pressure released 4 minutes in. New sounds for the neophiles. Goitia Deitz hail from Brooklyn, New York and are two DJs and producers that have been collaborating for the past year. Their recorded experiments in minimal electronics hint towards an extensive record collection and a mutual love of Krautrock, Kosmische and Italo. All tracks are produced on analog equipment, recorded live in one take with additional mixing by James Aparicio (These New Puritans, Liars, Spiritualized, Mute Records). Nothing is pre-planned or written. Each limited 7" vinyl has two tracks (bonus track 'Pictures In Motion' only available digitally) and will be shipped in silver foil bags with printed card inserts designed by Goitia Deitz and Ciaran O'Shea. We are very excited that this is DiscError's 10th vinyl release and the both vinyl and digital releases are available to pre-order now from the links above. For press and stockist inquiries or any further details please email us at discerrorrecordings@gmail.com PAST PRESS "Something different from somewhere else" DiscError "Despite its obvious Krautrock inspiration, there’s something almost Avant Hard-era Add N To (X) about Goitia Deitz; the manipulation of analogue equipment into explosive, hysterical, uncharted territory." Mishka NYC "An impressive affair, the Balearic/Chi soul refractions of the track above are accompanied, elsewhere, by some stunningly fierce motoric progressions infected by the same carnivorous bass virus that we find in Factory Floor’s death-head techno. This is only the beginning." 20 Jazz Funk Greats LINKS www.soundcloud.com/goitia-deitz Postage & Packaging £2 (UK) £3 (Other) £1 (As part of a larger order)

name: ECC. Photographs from Offset Festival 2
description:
Photographs by renowned photographer and dear friend of DiscError/ECC Thomas Kavanagh.

Following on from our previous book, this series of bold, striking images taken in and around our ECC stage at the last Offset Festival are presented in stark portrait form by Thomas Kavanagh and designer Ciaran O'Shea. Strictly limited A5 publication.

More details coming soon.

http://www.tomkavanagh.com/

Their recorded experiments in minimal electronics hint towards an extensive record collection and a shared bonding over their love of Krautrock, Kosmische and Italo. All tracks are produced on analog equipment, recorded live in one take with additional mixing by James Aparicio (These New Puritans, Liars, Spiritualized, Mute Records). Nothing is pre-planned or written. name: DEATH IN PLAINs 'Over and Above' (SOLD OUT)
description:
A. Over and Above
B. Clippings

FORMAT 7" Vinyl + Digital Download RELEASE DATE November 23rd 2010 CATALOGUE NUMBER DER006 DETAILS DEATH IN PLAINs is the brainchild of Enrico Boccioletti from Pesaro, Italy. Yet with a name loosely derived from SNES game Super Mario World, and a sound that joins Fuck Buttons to Jesus and Mary Chain via MGMT, he is as universal an artist as they come. Following a brilliant performance on the Experimental Circle Club stage at this year’s Offset Festival, single ‘Over and Above’ is a summer echo, the sound of serotonin rising; of legions of soaked T-shirted kids marching on the spot in a dancefloor half-dream: of the belief that everything might just be ok, at least until the end of the song. LINKS www.myspace.com/deathindonutplains Postage & Packaging £2 (UK) £3 (Other) £1 (Other) for Each Additional Order

name: ULTERIOR 'Sister Speed' (SOLD OUT)
description:
A. Sister Speed
AA. Aporia

FORMAT 10" Vinyl + Digital Download
RELEASE DATE July 2009
CATALOGUE NUMBER DER005

DETAILS
Fresh from powering through Europe on tour with Sisters of Mercy, ULTERIOR return with the double A side ‘Sister Speed/Aporia’. They have still kept hold of their uncompromising G&R meets Suicide rock style but it has evolved, grown teeth, to become a slick, deadly dark pop beast.

Exhibit A is 'Sister Speed', a careering instant rock classic with crunching guitars and rumbling bass.

Ballad 'Aporia' casts light on the bands ability to channel deep emotion into song, singer Honey’s voice laid bare over chemical-buzz synths. As the song progresses it increases in intensity with every reverb drenched hit of the snare drum: clocking in at over 6 minutes, it defines the word ‘epic’.

LINKS
www.ulteriorlondon.com
www.facebook.com/ulteriorlondon
www.myspace.com/electricityisblood

Postage & Packaging £2 (UK) £3 (Other)
£1 (Other) for Each Additional Order

description:
1. Weapons
2. Weapons (Zlaya Remix)
3. Weapons (Ade Fenton Remix)
4. Weapons (A.R.E Weapons Remix)

FORMAT 12" Vinyl + Digital Download
RELEASED December 2007
CATALOGUE DER002

DETAILS
Totally uncompromising, Ulterior are Benn McGregor (machines) brother Paul (vocals) Karls (Bass) and Paul Simmons (guitars). Ulterior's sound is brash, confrontational and engaging. The 12" comes backed by mixes by Zlaya and Ade Fenton and NYC's very own A.R.E. Weapons.
This debut single 'Weapons' has been featured on Playstation 3 game "Motorstorm 2". Other artists on the soundtrack include Primal Scream, Nirvana, David Bowie and Pendulum.

LINKS

name: Ipso Facto 'Harmonise' (SOLD OUT!)
description:
A. Harmonise
B. Balderdash

FORMAT Limited Edition 7" Vinyl + DVD
RELEASED November 2007
CATALOGUE DER001L

DETAILS
Dark, macabre, organ-led melodies, all underpinned by a searing vocal. Repackaged in a new hand numbered sleeve, includes a DVD copy of the 'Harmonise' promotional music video (DER001LDVD) directed by Tony Mines.

You will receive 1 of 40 hand-numbered records.

Ipso Facto were a goth-inflected, melodramatic psychedelic rock band. Founded in 2007 by Rosalie Cunningham (Singer, Songwriter, Guitar), Victoria Smith (Drums), Cherish Kaya (keyboards) and Samantha Valentine (Bass guitar). They were based in London but individually originated from different parts of the UK, including Southend, Newcastle and Bedford. Before Ipso Facto, Rosalie and Samantha played in the Southend band Theoretical Girl. Samantha is daughter of guitarist Hilton Valentine from The Animals.

Ipso Facto appeared on the 'BBC Introducing Stage' at the Reading Festival 2008, and supported The Last Shadow Puppets on their 2008 tour.

They supported post-punk band Magazine on their 2009 reunion tour.
Ipso Facto split up in 2009 and the members have gone separate ways. Rosalie Cunningham is continuing to write and record music with her new band Purson. Samantha Valentine has joined the band Romance, Cherish has gone to play keyboards for Florence and the Machine and Victoria Smith has been working on her own music and collaborating with various other artists.

PRESS
"Harmonise and the manic rock'n'roll riffs of its B-side Balderdash: a record that's so overwrought with banshee-like wailing that pheromones seem to emanate from its grooves. Basically, what we're saying is, it's brilliant."
NME Radar, Alex Miller, 2008

LINKS
www.myspace.com/ipsofactomyspace

Postage & Packaging £1 (UK) £2 (Other)
Add 50p (UK) £1 (Other) for Each Additional Order

name: ECC. Photographs from Offset Festival 2009
description:
Limited first run of 23 books. Numbered by hand.

ECC. Photographs from Offset Festival 2009, a limited edition book of photographs by Thomas Kavanagh documenting Offset Festival 2009, the ever-expanding, annual underground congregation in the Greater London hinterl and of Hainault Forest.

A collaboration between promoters Experimental Circle Club and record label DiscError, joint programmers of the ECC tent at Offset, this selection of stark, monochromatic portraits and live shots capture the tent's performers and general inhabitants during that heady weekend.

Please allow a week for delivery.
